alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor; Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 10:47PM PST until March 03 at 5:23PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and Thurston Counties. Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .No additional hydrologically significant rain is in the forecast for the next few days. The flood crest on the Chehalis will arrive at Grand Mound late Wednesday morning and at Porter Thursday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River Above Grand Mound. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 141.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Thurston County will flood several roads in Independence Valley including James Road, Independence Road, and Moon road. Flood waters will also cover nearby farm lands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 142.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 142.3 feet late Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 141.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday morning at 645 AM PST.
